title: JSON Schema for z/OS Unix Parmlib member BPXPRMxx
description: Schema for identifying Unix Parameters for YAML

name.description: A bogus entry just for demonstration purposes

lost_XCF_messages.description: Detect lost and duplicate XCF messages in a shared file system configuration.https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=features-lostmsg

auto_convert.description: Enable ASCII or Unicode Services checking. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=features-autocvt

maximum_memory_map_area.description: The maximum number of data space pages that can be allocated for memory mapping of z/OS® UNIX files. Storage is not allocated until memory mappings are active. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxmmaparea

maximum_file_size.description: Specifies the soft and hard resource values that are established as the initial values for new processes.https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=sc-parameters-16

maximum_io_buffer_per_user.description: Limit of each user's persistent kernel storage for IO buffers. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxiobufuser

component_trace_member.description: The data set member used for tracing while the kernel is starting.https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-ctrace

maximum_shared_member_segment_pages.description: The maximum number of pages for shared segments. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=parameters-statements-bpxprmxx

maximum_interprocess_semaphore_ids.description: The maximum number of interprocess semaphore ids. This setting has been deprecated and has no effect

maximum_simultaneous_open_files.description: The maximum number of open files. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxfileproc

smf_update_differentiation.description: Specify whether the smf_record() callable service differentiates between read and update access. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=features-smfupdate

process_wait_timeout.description: Determines whether a process waiting on a terminal should be timed out. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=features-pwt

maximum_simultaneous_sytem_processes.description: The maximum number of processes that can be active at the same time. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxprocsys

maximum_simultaneous_user_processes.description: The maximum number of processes that a single user can have concurrently active. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxprocuser

maximum_number_of_pseudo_terminals.description: The number of interactive shell sessions, where each interactive session requires one pseudo-TTY pair. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxptys

maximum_number_of_threads.description: The maximum number of threads that a single process can have active concurrently. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxthreads

maximum_number_of_thread_support_tasks.description: The maximum number of MVS™ tasks that a single process can have concurrently active. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxthreadtasks

maximum_address_space_size.description: The maximum region size (in bytes) for an address space that was created by rlogind, telnetd, and other daemons. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxassize

maximum_CPU_time.description: The time limit (in seconds) for processes that were created by rlogind, telnetd, and other daemons. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxcputime

maximum_number_of_shared_pages.description: The maximum number of shared storage pages that can be concurrently in use by z/OS UNIX functions. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=bpxprmxx-setting-process-limits-in-zos-unix

priority_goal_list.description: The list of service class names of 8 characters or less that are used with the nice(), setpriority(), and chpriority() callable services.https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-prioritygoal

maximum_user_pipes.description: The maximum number of named or unnamed pipes that a user (that is, a UID) can open and use concurrently. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-maxpipeuser

priority_pg_number_list.description: The list of performance group numbers that are used with the nice(), setpriority(), and chpriority() callable service. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=limits-prioritypg

step_library_list.description: The path name of the file in the file system that contains the list of MVS™ data sets to be used as step libraries for programs that have the set-user-id and set-group-id bit set on. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=features-stepliblist

file_system_type_info.description: Defines the available filesystems on the platform. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/3.1.0?topic=systems-filesystype

filesystems.description: File Systems to be mounted on the system at boot time

items.description: The file system to be mounted

networks.description: Networks associated with this network definition
